etymologies: modern Latin, named after Matthias de Lobel (1538–1616), Flemish botanist to James I

definitions: a chiefly tropical or subtropical plant of the bellflower family, in particular an annual widely grown as a bedding plant. Some kinds are aquatic, and some grow as thick-trunked shrubs or trees on African mountains.

notes.text: Genus Lobelia, family Campanulaceae: many species, including the popular blue-flowered L. erinus

shortDefinitions: chiefly tropical or subtropical plant of bellflower family
